name: British Roundtable
uniques: Comment [Britain's Finest: Build a unique sub-faction specific national wonder, with special bonuses, and ability to produce one-of-a-kind units.]
Comment [Anglican Order of the Lady Nimue: Employ versatile, hard-hitting infantry and reconaissance units.]
Comment [Her Majestyâ€™s Van Helsing Regiment: Use specialised, supernatural units that are royal to the Crown. From werewolves, to vampires and dragons.]
Comment [Royal Society of Arcane Pursuits: Construct machines fueled using sorcery, such as steampunk airships and tesla coils.]

name: Papal Inquisition
uniques: Earn [100]% of killed [all] unit's [Strength] as [Faith] <for [Human] units> <hidden from users>
May buy [Angelic] units with [Faith] [in all cities] <hidden from users>
Comment [In God's Name: Employ powerful infantry, that gain faith equivelant to enemy strength.]
Comment [Working Miracles: All non-Angelic units have a chance to become a Living Saint unit upon death.]
Comment [Guardian Angels: Purchase powerful Angelic units using faith.]
Comment [The Word of the Almighty: Weaponise word of God with blessed, explosive and homing pages of the Bible.]

name: Blood Pyramid
uniques: Provides [1] [Vampire Population] <for every [Cities]> <hidden from users>
Comment [Rules of the Masquerade: Cities can only sustain a fixed number of Vampires. Gain Vampire Population from buildings and every owned city.]

Comment [Vampire Bloodlines: Each Vampire is bound to their sire, and that sire to another. But all are bound to their blood. Each Vampire unit chooses a free Bloodline promotion, each with unique bonuses.]
Comment [Pyramid Scheme: With increasing Vampire Population, you gain access to more powerful Vampire units. All subjects need a lord, but when there's too many lords, they too become subjects.]
Comment [Crimson Servitude: Recruit and create armies of ghouls - mind-manipulated slaves, bound by Vampire blood.]
